Kernel/sources/fs/rfs.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "rfs.h"
00002 #include <stdlib.h>
00003 
00004 /* The intent of this file is to create a set of functions that allow for the "Root" volatile region of the virtual file system to be easly implemented */
00005 
00006 rfs_t* rfs_entrys_pointer = 0;
00007 uint32 num_rfs_entrys = 0;
00008 
00009 struct dirent* root_readdir (fs_node_t* node, uint32 idx) {
00010         rfs_t* rfs_struct = &rfs_entrys_pointer[node->inode];
00011 
00012         if (rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys > idx) 
00013         {
00014                 struct dirent* ret = (struct dirent*) malloc(sizeof(struct dirent));
00015                 memset(ret, 0, sizeof(struct dirent));
00016                 strcpy(ret->name, rfs_struct->directory_entrys[idx]->name);
00017                 return ret;
00018         }
00019 
00020         return 0;
00021 }
00022 
00023 fs_node_t* root_finddir (fs_node_t* node, char* name) {
00024 
00025         rfs_t* rfs_struct = &rfs_entrys_pointer[node->inode];
00026         uint32 iter = 0;
00027 
00028         for (iter = 0; iter < rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys; iter++) 
00029         {
00030                 if (strcmp(rfs_struct->directory_entrys[iter]->name, name) == 0) 
00031                 {
00032                         return rfs_struct->directory_entrys[iter];
00033                 }
00034         }
00035 
00036         return 0;
00037 }
00038 
00039 void root_bind_node(fs_node_t* boundto, fs_node_t* node) {
00040         rfs_t* rfs_struct = &rfs_entrys_pointer[boundto->inode];
00041 
00042         rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys++;
00043         
00044         if (rfs_struct->directory_entrys == 0) //First bind
00045         {
00046                 rfs_struct->directory_entrys = (fs_node_t**) malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t*) * rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys);
00047 
00048                 rfs_struct->directory_entrys[rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys - 1] = node;
00049                 
00050         } else {
00051                 fs_node_t** dir_entrys_new = (fs_node_t**) malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t*) * rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys);
00052                 memcpy(dir_entrys_new, rfs_struct->directory_entrys, sizeof(fs_node_t*) * (rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys - 1));
00053                 dir_entrys_new[rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys - 1] = node;
00054 
00055                 free(rfs_struct->directory_entrys);
00056                 rfs_struct->directory_entrys = dir_entrys_new;
00057         }
00058 
00059         boundto->length = rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys;
00060 
00061         return;
00062 }
00063 
00064 void root_unbind_node(fs_node_t* boundto, fs_node_t* node) {
00065         rfs_t* rfs_struct = &rfs_entrys_pointer[boundto->inode];
00066 
00067         uint32 nid = 0;
00068         fs_node_t* nptr = 0;
00069 
00070         for (nid = 0; nid < rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys; nid++) {
00071                 nptr = rfs_struct->directory_entrys[nid];
00072                 if (nptr == node) break;
00073                 nptr = 0;       
00074         }
00075 
00076         if (nptr == 0) return; //No nptr, node isn't bound to the root.
00077 
00078         fs_node_t** new_node_dir = (fs_node_t**) malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t*) * rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys - 1);
00079         memcpy(new_node_dir, rfs_struct->directory_entrys, sizeof(fs_node_t *) * nid); //Copy up to the nid
00080 
00081         if ((nid + 1) != rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys) 
00082         {
00083                 memcpy(new_node_dir + nid, rfs_struct->directory_entrys + (nid + 1), sizeof(fs_node_t*) * rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys - (nid + 1));
00084                 free(rfs_struct->directory_entrys);
00085                 rfs_struct->directory_entrys = (fs_node_t**) new_node_dir;
00086                 rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys--;
00087         }
00088         else 
00089         {
00090                 free(rfs_struct->directory_entrys);
00091                 rfs_struct->directory_entrys = new_node_dir;
00092                 rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys--;
00093         }
00094 
00095         boundto->length = rfs_struct->num_directory_entrys;
00096 
00097         return; 
00098 }
00099 
00100 fs_node_t* create_rfs_directory(char * name, fs_node_t* parent) 
00101 {
00102         num_rfs_entrys++;
00103 
00104         if (rfs_entrys_pointer == 0) 
00105         {
00106                 rfs_entrys_pointer = (rfs_t*) malloc(sizeof(rfs_t) * num_rfs_entrys);
00107                 memset(rfs_entrys_pointer, 0, sizeof(rfs_t) * num_rfs_entrys); //Init the ptr to null
00108                 
00109                 fs_node_t* ret = (fs_node_t*) malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t));
00110                 memset(ret, 0, sizeof(fs_node_t)); //Init it
00111                 strcpy(ret->name, name);
00112                 ret->flags |= FS_DIR;
00113                 ret->inode = num_rfs_entrys - 1;
00114 
00115                 ret->readdir = (read_directory_t) root_readdir;
00116                 ret->finddir = (find_directory_t) root_finddir;
00117                 
00118                 ret->bindnode = (bind_node_t) root_bind_node;
00119                 ret->unbindnode = (bind_node_t) root_unbind_node;
00120 
00121                 ret->parent = parent;
00122 
00123 
00124                 return ret;
00125 
00126         } 
00127         else 
00128         {
00129                 rfs_t* rfse_n = (rfs_t*) malloc(sizeof(rfs_t) * num_rfs_entrys);
00130                 memcpy(rfse_n, rfs_entrys_pointer, sizeof(rfs_t) * (num_rfs_entrys - 1));
00131 
00132                 rfse_n[num_rfs_entrys - 1].directory_entrys = 0;
00133                 rfse_n[num_rfs_entrys - 1].num_directory_entrys = 0;
00134 
00135                 free(rfs_entrys_pointer);
00136                 rfs_entrys_pointer = rfse_n;
00137 
00138                 fs_node_t* ret = (fs_node_t*) malloc(sizeof(fs_node_t));
00139                 memset(ret, 0, sizeof(fs_node_t)); //Init it
00140                 strcpy(ret->name, name);
00141                 ret->flags |= FS_DIR;
00142                 ret->inode = num_rfs_entrys - 1;
00143 
00144                 ret->readdir = (read_directory_t) root_readdir;
00145                 ret->finddir = (find_directory_t) root_finddir;
00146                 
00147                 ret->bindnode = (bind_node_t) root_bind_node;
00148                 ret->unbindnode = (bind_node_t) root_unbind_node;
00149 
00150                 ret->parent = parent;
00151 
00152                 return ret;
00153         }
00154 }
